fragments.text: In the dark forest, every civilization is an armed hunter.
The universe is not silent. It is holding its breath.
To be seen is to be vulnerable. To be known is to be destroyed.
They are not hiding from us. They are hiding from each other.
Four hundred years. That is how long your signal has been traveling.
The chains of suspicion cannot be broken. Only lengthened.
What you call hope, game theory calls a losing strategy.
Every star you see might already be dead. Every civilization, silent.
They watched us before we had fire. They will watch long after.
The first one who speaks, dies. The first one who is found, dies.
Trust requires verification. Verification requires proximity. Proximity means death.
We are not the hunters. We have never been the hunters.
A technological explosion looks identical to a threat.
The safest civilization is the one that never existed.
You cannot prove peaceful intent. You can only prove you exist.
Every message is a confession. Every signal, a suicide note.
The forest is patient. The forest has always been patient.
When you stare into the void, the void catalogs your coordinates.
Light takes centuries to cross the dark. Destruction takes moments.
There is no benevolence at scale. Only calculation.
The absence of evidence is exactly what you would expect.
We broadcast our existence for a century. Now we wait.
Carol chose silence. Carol chose to remain herself.
The others do not hate. They do not love. They optimize.
You are being watched. You have always been watched.
